verses.text: 大施屠殺我聽見他大聲呼叫說：「懲罰這城的啊！你們要近前來，各人手裡拿著滅命的武器。」

words.note: Functions as an exclamation or chapter title in some biblical contexts.
Indicates successful completion of hearing.
Here nominalizes 'punish this city' to 'those who punish this city'.
Often used to express emphasis or as a vocative particle.

verses.text: 忽然，有六個人從朝北的上門那邊走來，各人手裡拿著殺人的武器；他們中間有一個人身穿細麻布衣服，腰間帶著墨盒子；他們進來，站在銅祭壇旁邊。
以色列 神的榮耀本來是在基路伯上面的，現在從那裡移到殿的門檻；耶和華把那身穿細麻布衣服，腰間帶著墨盒子的人召來，

words.note: A special spacing character often used in Chinese Bibles to set off divine names.
Specifically refers to divine glory here.
Emphasizes the location or state.
Indicates the following noun is the object of the verb.
Connects the descriptive phrase to the noun '人'.

verses.text: 對他說：「你要走遍耶路撒冷全城，那些因城中所行的一切可憎的事而歎息悲哀的人，你要在他們的額上畫個記號。」

words.note: Classical Chinese structure forming a nominalized phrase.
Connects the descriptive phrase to the noun '人'.

verses.text: 我又聽見他對其餘的人說：「你們要跟隨他走遍那城，進行殺戮；你們的眼不要顧惜，你們也不要憐恤。
你們要從我的聖所開始，把老年人、少年人、少女、孩童和婦女都殺盡滅絕，只是那些額上有記號的人，你們都不可傷害。」於是他們從殿前那些長老開始殺戮。

words.note: Lit. 'holy place'.
An intensive compound verb meaning to kill completely.
Common in religious contexts, refers to church elders.

verses.text: 他又對他們說：「你們要玷污這殿，使這些院子充滿被殺的人；你們出去吧！」於是他們出去，在城中進行殺戮。

words.note: Often used in a religious or moral context.

verses.text: 以西結的禱告不蒙垂聽他們殺戮的時候，只留下我一個人，我就臉伏在地，呼叫說：「哎，主耶和華啊！難道你要向耶路撒冷傾倒你的烈怒，使所有以色列餘剩的人都滅絕麼？」

words.note: Also functions as a verb 'to pray'.
A formal expression meaning 'to be granted a hearing'.
Used to express rhetorical questions implying disbelief or surprise.

verses.text: 他對我說：「以色列家和猶大家罪大惡極，地上充滿血腥，城內充滿不義，因為他們說：『耶和華已經離開這地，他看不見我們了！』

words.note: An idiom describing extreme wickedness.
Often used to describe violent or cruel scenes.

verses.text: 因此，我的眼必不顧惜，我也必不憐恤；我要把他們所行的報應在他們的頭上。」

words.note: A formal construction to nominalize a verb phrase.
Can be verb 'to repay' or noun 'retribution'.

verses.text: 那身穿細麻布衣服，腰間帶著墨盒子的人回報這事，說：「我已經照著你所吩咐我的行了。」

words.note: Lit. 'body wear'
A common material for garments in biblical times.
Refers to a scribe's portable inkstand and writing implements (Ezekiel 9:2).
Used to nominalize a verb phrase.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun.
